name: Team Gleason
bio:
Empowering people with ALS to live purposeful lives.
Steve types with his eyes. If his posts sound crazy, they probably are.
No White Flags!

Even though @ugaathletics is playing @lsufootball tomorrow, we'll let is slide for just today as we celebrate their community for giving Wendy the "BEST DAY OF MY LIFE!" 

Wendy's amazing personality shines through as she writes about her recent Team Gleason Adventure to watch her beloved Georgia Bulldogs and have the most fantastic #DawgNation experience! Here's a small sample of what she had to say:

"There are ABSOLUTELY no words for how magical this trip was!

I especially want to thank Team Gleason for making my life dream come through. It’s cool that it was on the 1 year anniversary of being diagnosed with ALS. Worst day ever…God redeemed!!!

Best day of my life!!!"

Read now via the link in our bio or in our stories! 

✨ Team Gleason would like to extend a special thanks to the @universityofga for providing the tickets and parking for Wendy’s Adventure.

#TeamGleason #TeamGleasonAdventure #nowhiteflags #ALS #godawgs #football #universityofgeorgia #lsu #gotigers #bucketlist

We can't wait to share more photos of the event soon! Check back! 

#gleasongras2022 #gleasongras #nowhiteflags #therevival #permobil #permobilfoundation #permobilcares#powerwheelchair #mobility

🎂Today we celebrate Emily! As our Speech Language Pathologist, Emily sees patients multiple times per week, assisting them in learning new technology, trialing communication devices, and so much more.

As part of our Innovation Team, Emily also brings her clinical knowledge and expertise to the forefront as Team Gleason works alongside partners to develop assistive technology and best practices. 

Emily brings joy to both her patients and the Team Gleason office each time she steps through the door. 

🎉Please join us in wishing Emily a birthday as special as she is!

On behalf of our family, I want to say thank you to Team Gleason who made this Adventure possible. I have no words to describe the happy faces of my husband Jaime, my son and my niece throughout this Adventure!

My husband is a huge Astros Fan and my son is a Red Sox fan. We visited three baseball stadiums on the trip: Fenway, Citi Field and Yankee stadium.

The crown of the adventure being Astros and Boston Fans is @yankeestadium. Visiting this stadium and the history it holds as this was the home of Lou Gehrig, who also suffered from ALS, seeing all the memorial that the Yankees had dedicated to Lou and his legacy was amazing. 

Read all about Jaime’s Adventure to three different baseball stadiums! Link in our bio and stories!

Thank you to @fenwaypark @yankeestadium and @citifield for the amazing tours! 

@redsox @yankees @mets #baseball #fenwaypark #citifield #yankees #redsox #mets #adventure #teamgleason #nowhiteflags #als #stadiumtour #teamgleasonadventure

In 2019, Kendel was diagnosed with ALS at the age of 35. This is her story.

Currently, Team Gleason is on track to fulfill 4,000 requests to ALS patients across the country this year alone - and your support has enabled us to do that. 
Watch to see the impact that you’ve made on Kendel, and so many other’s, lives.

Help us continue saying “yes” by making a financial contribution today to help us reach our goal by December 31st.

More than 10 years after her ALS diagnosis, Linda was able to have an action packed Florida trip with her family and amazing support team. Team Gleason was thrilled to support Linda as she spent a week in Orlando visiting the happiest place on earth, and another two weeks soaking up the sun on Marco Island.

Read all about Linda’s trip now on our latest blog or using the link in our bio!

#teamgleason #nowhiteflags #teamgleasonadventure #disneyworld #disney #beach #marcoisland #advenure #als #travelingwithals

Team Gleason celebrated the holidays at the beautiful @coppervinewinepub! We played games, sang some Christmas carols, and took the time to appreciate each other and amazing ALS community we serve.

Special thank you to Team Gleason board member Kyle Brechtel for hosting us! 

#teamgleason #stevegleason #als #nowhiteflags #coppervine #holidayparty #merrychristmas

David Jan Campbell was diagnosed with ALS in March 2021. His family reached out to Team Gleason to help with his dream Adventure to Boston with a stop in Newport, RI to go sailing. Team Gleason was thrilled to help make this dream a reality.

“This trip means so very much to all of us. Especially my dad,” his daughter Rachel tells us. “It just all wouldn’t have been possible without the gracious help of Team Gleason. We are all so very grateful that words can’t even begin to explain.” 

#teamgleason #nowhiteflags #als #alsadventure #teamgleasonadventure #boston #fenwaypark #sailing #newportbeach #newport #dreamtrip

Happy birthday to this super star! Kristi joined our team in July and has quickly become an integral part of our development team. We are so lucky she’s one of us. Help us wish her a very Happy Birthday!

“I was diagnosed with ALS in February of 2019.

After a month of feeling angry and then sad, I decided not to let my diagnosis stop me from completing my LIFE LIST.

Traveling on @amtrak across the country will now be checked off and we can’t thank Team Gleason enough for helping us to do that.

This is an example of living my life in the best way and being the designer of said life. I feel alive, curious and confident that I won’t worry about yesterday or tomorrow. Times are tough but this vacation allowed us to get away from the stresses of our day to day.

Thank you, Team Gleason, for helping me to enjoy the present and all the newly created moments.”

➡️ Read all about Tommy’s San Francisco Adventure using the link in our bio! 

#teamgleason #teamgleasonadventure #als #nowhiteflags #sanfrancisco #california #amtrak #jimihendrix #travelingwithals

✨Wishing an incredible birthday to our Logistics Coordinator, Chontayia! Shon oversees that all technology and equipment arrive safe and sound to those who need it most. In addition, she’s always the best dressed in the office!! Join us in wishing Shon a very happy birthday! 🎂

A year after her official diagnosis, veterans Mary Grace and her husband, Alex, are determined to keep traveling and having new adventures. 

When they reached out about continuing their goal to see all 63 National Parks, Team Gleason was excited about sending them to two of the most remote parks in the country: Lake Clark National Park & Preserve and Katmai National Park & Preserve in Alaska.

To help fund more exciting Adventures like Mary Grace’s visit: www.TeamGleason.org/Donate

Amnon “Max” Salomon was a beloved husband and father. Sadly, he lost his battle with ALS in 2020.
Thanks to the power of Voice Preservation technology provided by Team Gleason, Max was able to provide one last gift to his family - two years after he passed.

Watch this video to see how Max and his family used Voice Preservation. Max’s memory, humor, and love for his family live on in his wedding speech to his son, Jared. 

Help us continue providing services that immediately impact those living with ALS by making a financial contribution today to help us reach our goal of $250,000 by December 31st.

➡️ Watch the full video of The Power of Voice Preservation by using the link in our bio or heading over to our Facebook! 

#teamgleason #nowhiteflags #voicepreservation #als #ALScommunity #amyotrophiclateralsclerosis #lougehrigsdisease

Wishing you a peaceful and reflective 2023! 🎇 Happy New Year from our family to yours!

#happynewyear #2023 #teamgleason

💪 May this year be as adventurous and empowering as the last! Here’s a look at our end of the year Adventure Program wrap up for 2022. 

#teamgleason #teamgleasonadventure #nowhiteflags #als

🎂 Every day is a party when you’re the professional event planner! We are so grateful for our Events and Development Associate, Jamie, and we know 2023 will be full of fun with her on our team. Please join us in wishing her a very happy birthday and if you see her this year at any Team Gleason event, say hi! 👋

The full Moon is today!
Oh, also I was diagnosed with ALS 12 years ago, so I'm 9 years past my expiration date.

It's been a year of growth, none of which would be possible without the enormous amount of love & support around me.

So grateful for my care crew and Team Gleason staff. -SG

In the last year, you’ve helped us raise over 1.1 million dollars to benefit those living with ALS. In 2022, we had a total of 31 third party events supporting Team Gleason and over 435 online fundraisers with 1,850 individual donors! Watch this short video to see some of the highlights from 2022.
 
Interested in holding a fundraising event to benefit Team Gleason this year? Get started or get more information by filling out the form via the link in our bio!

Did you know that in 2022, Team Gleason handled over 800 shipments of equipment and assistive technology? This is all thanks to our Shipping Department: Logistics Coordinator, Shon, and Technology and Equipment Associate, Mary!

Together, this dream team works endlessly to ensure that devices arrive quickly and safely to people living with ALS all over the country.

In 2022, our team sent out 809 total shipments, including:

🔸211 AAC Devices

🔸291 Voice Banking Equipment

🔸134 Chair and Floor Mounts

🔸173 General Shipments

Our top month was June, with a record breaking number of 110 shipments going out in just 30 days! 

The Shipping Department also handles all returns and donations, guaranteeing that each device in our closet is fully utilized. 

Way to go, Shon and Mary!

Today we celebrate Clare! Since joining the team in 2011, she has been a huge part of the success of Team Gleason. Clare’s passionate work impacts not only those living with ALS, but so many more living with disabilities who will benefit from her advocacy and legislative efforts. Clare is the person we can always turn to for both support, comfort, and a good laugh. She is a true powerhouse for the ALS community and we are lucky to have her on our team. Happy birthday, Clare!

“I didn’t expect the trip to be as amazing as it was, from the luxury accommodations at a resort in Honolulu to the amazing scuba diving experience itself. 

I would’ve been happy to just put on a mask and air tanks and go underwater and see some pretty things. But before I could even do that, the Trident Adventures team called to see if I wanted to jump out of a helicopter into the water first. 

Of course, I said, yes!” - Dave W. 

🤿 🌊 Read all about Dave’s Team Gleason Adventure to Honolulu, Hawaii, where the @tridentadventureshawaii team assisted with Adaptive Scuba Diving! Link in bio!

The Baumann Family adventure to the Grand Canyon exceeded our wildest dreams and was over and above our expectations!

Team Gleason, thank you for making the Grand Canyon Adventure a reality for our family. It truly was a life changing experience that came at the perfect time in our lives.

It is true that ALS definitely changes your life and the lives of those you love, but it can NEVER take away your freedom to choose to persevere despite the circumstances. Diversity of any type, has the strange potential to grow character to unimaginable heights; it all comes down to a choice! This family chooses “NO WHITE FLAGS EVER!”

Love,
The Baumann Family

Rhonda’s blog beautifully captures her family’s Grand Canyon Adventure, emotions and all. Give it a read, link in our bio.

“My mom, cousin, uncle and I are very thankful that we got to share this experience with each other. It made us all closer than we were before. Family is very important, and we are also happy we got to experience it together.

The trip turned out the best way it possibly could have. We did not have any difficulties or challenges that we had to overcome, and it was a very nice relaxing time.

As my uncle says, “live like you’re dying,” make every experience the best. You choose your perspective on life, make it a good one and be happy with what you have done. Thank you again Team Gleason. We never could have done this without you.” -Tawni N., niece of pALS John Elkins. 

Team Gleason was excited to help John and his family make their dream trip to Hawaii come true! His niece, Tawni, wrote about their Adventure in a sweet blog. Link in bio to read all about it. 

#teamgleason #nowhiteflags #als #hawaii

“I’m so very thankful to Team Gleason for their generous seat elevator grant for my @permobilusa power wheelchair. The ease which I am able to adapt to my wheelchair is astounding. The range of motion afforded to me by the seat elevator allows me to get into the wheelchair easier and allows me have normal meals with my family and have quality time with them. 

It also allows me to rise to the occasion when pictures and conversation happen with my family and friends as I am now at eye level and excited to communicate with everyone. 

Because of my ALS diagnosis, I was recently forced to retire as a civil servant with the United States Navy. I was recently honored by the local ROTC unit and VFW for my 50 years of service as both active-duty Navy and civil service. My wheelchair made it possible to stand tall and proud. I hope that are able to honor many more veterans with your kind and generous support.” -Thomas B., Corpus Christi, TX

In Partnership with the @permobilfoundation, Team Gleason will continue to help more individuals living with ALS stay more independent.

Join us in celebrating Daniel today! As part of the Innovation Team, Daniel serves as our Lead Technology and Equipment Specialist! 

The only thing more impressive than his smarts is his willingness to step in and find an answer to any question! Daniel’s ability to research and implement accessible solutions is critical for our team and the community we serve.

Team Gleason was thrilled to send Christine and her husband, Paul, on a dream trip to the World of Coca-Cola Museum in Atlanta, GA. 

Hailing from Waterford, MI, Christine is a true Coca-Cola fan and collector, and we couldn’t be more excited to send her on a private tour of the museum! 

“We saw so much and learned so much about the history of Coke, from how it was created, how the logo came to be, the bottles, vending machines, marketing, and corporate philosophy.  

We saw the Olympic torches used in the eternal flame torch runs which Coca-Cola sponsored, and I got to hold the torch that Mohammed Ali held when he lit the flame at the opening ceremony of the 1996 Olympics in Atlanta.  

We tasted various coke products from around the world (who knew?), and ended the tour in the gift shop, where I added just a little to my collection of Coca Cola items.” -Christine

➡️ Link in bio for the blog and more photos from their trip!

*A very special thank you to @worldofcocacola and @cocacolaunited for providing a private tour for Christine.

Team Gleason is thrilled to surprise a lifelong @chiefs fan, Craig Fuchs, with tickets to Superbowl LVII. Craig Fuchs from Kansas City and his family will attend the Super Bowl in Phoenix, Arizona, on February 12th as part of the Team Gleason Foundation Adventure Program. Fuchs was diagnosed with ALS (Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis) in 2022. 

Fuchs, a longtime Professor of Music at Pittsburg State University, is also a former TD Pack band member, Fuchs performed at Kansas City Chiefs games back in the day. Now, he and his family get the opportunity to see his beloved team compete at the Superbowl.

Since 2011, Team Gleason has given ADA Super Bowl tickets to people with ALS. In addition to Fuchs, Team Gleason will also be sending two additional people living with ALS, including a Philadelphia Eagles fan, to Superbowl LVII. The Team Gleason Adventure Program creates lasting and oftentimes, life changing memories for individuals and families living with ALS. 

Thank you to the NFL Events Department for providing the Super Bowl tickets and Andrew Jo, National Football League Sr. Manager of Retired Players Program, for coordinating the experience. 

The ALS Association Mid-America Chapter, joined by former Chiefs snapper Kendall Gammon and Kansas City radio host Steven St. John, presented Fuchs and his family with the surprise of a lifetime. 

Check out the full video to see the surprise unfold - link in bio! 

#TeamGleason #nowhiteflags #als #ALScommunity #SuperBowlLVII

"For more than 50 years I was a broadcast journalist.  During that half century I worked in commercial, public, educational, and international broadcasting - in management, in the classroom, and on the air.  My voice and the words I wrote were heard around the world.

Now ALS is all too quickly quieting my voice - my once brisk baritone is now a halting hoarse whisper.  And hands that once typed 100 words a minute are reduced to a few fingers slowly poking out one letter at a time.

The very core of my life’s work has been the ability to communicate, and the prospect of losing that skill has produced more anguish than any other aspect of ALS.

Team Gleason to the rescue - both materially and psychologically.  Steve Gleason’s inspiring story and the positive, proactive team that has rallied around him offered immediate encouragement that my days as a communicator were not over - indeed, should never end.

My speech therapist, who, among others, alerted me about Team Gleason, had urged me to bank my voice so that I could someday load it on a text-to-speech device. 

My wife and I applied to Team Gleason for a grant to cover the hefty insurance copay for the TD Pilot. Team Gleason graciously accepted our grant application, and to our surprise and lasting gratitude, also agreed to buy the lifetime license to my Acapela voice, as well as the Predictable AAC app, which can read aloud in my voice the text I have typed with my eyes.

When ALS silences my vocal cords and stills my fingers, I won’t raise a white flag.  Instead I will continue to communicate as I have for decades with the written and spoken word, thanks in great part to the material support and the encouragement of Team Gleason.”

Gratefully,
Bill T., Gaithersburg, MD

#TeamGleason #NoWhiteFlags #ALS #ALScommunity
Our Team Gleason Adventurers made it to #SuperBowlLvII! Be sure to follow along on our stories to watch their adventure unfold! #teamgleason #als #nowhiteflags

💌Team Gleason has a crush on YOU!

Team Gleason is excited to announce that the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) released a proposed National Coverage Determination decision that would expand coverage for power seat elevation equipment on certain power wheelchairs to Medicare recipients.

Once again, it took the power of the ALS community working together with other patient communities and organizations to help Medicare understand the necessity of this technology to live with diseases like ALS. Thank you to everyone who posted comments and shared your stories with CMS. While this benefit is not finalized, your voices have made this a reality.

Our continued work with the ITEM Coalition to increase awareness on issues important to the ALS and disability communities is grounded and led by those who use and need complex equipment and technology. Coupled with the voices of the ALS community, we share a message of gratitude to them, as well as CMS, in proposing this much needed benefit.

CMS has opened a new comment period closing March 17th. Please visit www.Rise4Access.org to learn more. Stay tuned for suggestions on how to encourage them to finalize seat elevation as a covered benefit. 

[Photo: David M., Whiting, NJ]

#teamgleason #nowhiteflags #als #rise4access #seatelevation

🚨 Are you a wheelchair user? Medicare wants to hear from YOU! Take action by March 17, 2023.

As you may know, Medicare recently proposed to cover, for the first time ever, seat elevation systems in power wheelchairs. This is a major victory for the ALS and disability communities, but our work is not yet done! 

We need to show Medicare that wheelchair users and people with disabilities strongly support this coverage, and urge Medicare to go even further to ensure that all those who need access to these systems can get it.

As you know, these systems are vital for wheelchair users to be able to:

⭐️ Safely transfer from a wheelchair to another surface, particularly if it is not level with your chair;

⭐️Increase your reach to access higher surfaces across the home;

⭐️Prevent and reduce stress injuries from repetitive transfers and reaching; 
 
⭐️Function independently at home as much as possible.

➡️ Medicare is currently accepting public comments through Friday, March 17 about whether to finalize coverage for power seat elevation systems, and will be considering additional comments about power standing systems at a later date. 

Please share your story and let Medicare know how you or someone you love benefits from these technologies in the home. To submit comments to Medicare, please go to the link in our bio! 

#als #teamgleason #medicare #cms #seatelevator #nowhiteflags

"Oh, what a difference my seat elevator has made!

Thanks to the elevator seat, I can access items in cabinets, bookshelves, and other places with stability. My wife’s role as caregiver has been eased considerably because of the elevator seat allowing me a greater degree of independence.

Thanks to Team Gleason for the grant. Everyone has been courteous, kind, supportive, and professional. My present quality of life has been greatly enhanced because of the elevator seat. It would not have happened without Team Gleason!"

Wayne P., Farmington, MO

🌸 Say hello to Kacie, our Content Development Specialist! Kacie joined our team in 2021 and has been an integral part of our growth ever since. If you ever DM us on social - she's usually the one to respond and make sure you're connected with the right person on our team. The highlight of her role at Team Gleason is being trusted to share so many inspiring stories within the ALS community. 

When she's not writing press releases or editing mountains of content, you can probably find her in the kitchen whipping up an iced Matcha latte or a fancy coffee. Fun facts about Kacie are that she's ambidextrous (but truly a lefty!), is a regular at @evolvecoffeenola, and has two kitties named Mochi and Miso! #teamgleason #als #nowhiteflags #spotlight

"Here’s a picture of me with Abigail and Annabella with their voice amplifiers on like their Grammy!  I also have a picture with older sister, Ashtyn, serenading the neighborhood with my microphone 😂 

I wish we all saw disabilities through the eyes of children. They see all my adaptations, from my power wheelchair to my voice amplification system, as so very cool; doesn’t make them sad, which I’m so grateful for." -Brenda R., Louisiana #teamgleason #als #nowhiteflags #accessibility

💕 If compassion had another name, it might just be Kelly! As our Support Services Coordinator, Kelly's role focuses on guiding those living with ALS and providing resources to their caregivers and family members. Kelly spearheads Team Gleason's virtual gatherings, creating spaces for those in the ALS community to navigate this disease. 

🎂 Please join us in wishing Kelly a very happy birthday!

"We would like to THANK YOU for the gift of the seat lift. Team Gleason [ and @gonumotion ] made this so easy for us as we did not need to 'jump through hoops' for help, this helped out tremendously! 

You should have seen Eddie's smile when he was in his chair... the ROHO cushion is so comfortable for him, and a provides him a feel of independence again. 

We were recently celebrating his birthday with our family, dinner was ready, and we went out front to see where my husband was...we gave up as he was nowhere to be found. It turns out, his sense of independence brought him up to the court and he was talking to our neighbors! I am so happy that he has this.

I have attached a few photos, one when we just received it and the 2nd showing his license plate on the back of the wheelchair - FAST EDDIE. 

Thank you so much again for this beautiful gift!" Maria and Eddie W., Hoffman Estates, IL

#teamgleason #als #nowhiteflags #gonumotion #numotion #seatelevator

We're honored to celebrate these amazing women of Team Gleason who continue to advocate and find solutions to support the ALS community.

We recognize the remarkable women living with ALS, and those who serve as physicians, clinicians, researchers, caregivers, and other essential roles in our community. You make awesome look easy.

#teamgleason #als #internationalwomensday #awesomeainteasy

Team Gleason was thrilled to send Steve, a lifelong firefighter and rescue diver, on an Adventure to Hawaii. Steve was able to dive for FUN, and not work, for the first time 🌊 Link in bio to read more!

“We were selected as the family from Kansas City to represent Team Gleason at the Super Bowl.  This is just crazy.  What a whirlwind of a week. 

We found out on Sunday, February 4th that we were going.  After an intense week of planning, we were on our way. 

The trip was truly incredible in every way.  We were able to experience the total vibe of the event since we were out there a couple of days early.  We were able to catch up with some friends who live out there that we hadn’t seen for a couple of years.  We were able to meet up with some friends from the Kansas City area who were also there for the game, but that we hadn’t seen for over 10 years. We went to the NFL Experience and NFL Live area.  We did our best to take it all in.

Most importantly, we were able to meet the other two families who were sent by Team Gleason.  This was something I was very much looking forward to.  As you all know, unless you live in this environment, you really don’t know the full effect of what the disease brings to you and your family.  Yes, the game was amazing, our seats were amazing, and the entire weekend was something we as a family will never forget.  But I am sure you will understand when I say that meeting and interacting with those other two families was an equally meaningful aspect to the trip.” -Craig Fuchs

🌟 Every year, community members from across the country set up fundraising events to benefit Team Gleason and those living with ALS. To show our gratitude, we’ll be featuring various 3rd party fundraisers and shining a spotlight on the individuals who make them happen!

Even before her ALS diagnosis in December of 2020, Dr. Valerie Kiper has been a true inspiration to those who know her. Serving as the Regional Dean of the School of Nursing at Texas Tech University, Valerie serves as a mentor, guiding the next generation of nurses - she even has a scholarship named after her!

After her diagnosis, Valerie was connected with Team Gleason, where she completed Voice and Message banking. Using her iPad to type and a voice amplifier as a speaker, Valerie recently gave a speech to over 300 people at the Panhandle Great 25 Nurses ceremony. Those who know Valerie say she is kind, loving, a bit of a firecracker, and most important, can play a serious round of golf.

⛳️ After working with the foundation, it was a no-brainer to Val and her husband, Jim, to start a Golf Tournament benefitting Team Gleason. The Inaugural Val Kiper ALS Golf Tournament benefitting Team Gleason was held on Monday, October 10, 2022, at the Tascosa Golf Club in Amarillo, Texas. The tournament included 38 golf teams, 27 Sponsors, and 21 in-kind sponsors. The event grossed more than $76k and raised over $60k for Team Gleason Foundation.

The Val Kiper ALS Golf Tournament consisted of 18 committee members, made up of family and friends, who came together to plan the Golf tournament in just 10 weeks.

The tournament started with an introduction from Val Kiper using her Speech Generating Device and ended with a dinner and awards at the Clubhouse. There was also a raffle and silent auction.

“I think the biggest takeaway is that the tournament was about a tight-knit community that came together to support one of its own,” said Jamie Clark, Team Gleason’s Events and Development Associate. “So many people who know or work with Val showed up to be there for her.”

⁉️Did you know that there are actually two types of Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis? 

Sporadic ALS is the most common form of ALS. In the United States, around 90% of individuals are diagnosed with ALS with no known cause or family history. Around 10% of individuals diagnosed have a known family history of ALS – this is known as Familial ALS.

"In 2000, I met my wife, Vanessa, while we both were working in Yellowstone National Park and after the summer season she moved to Big Sky Resort and I moved to Grand Targhee Resort.  I went to visit her and we had first date at Big Sky on Valentine’s Day, at a small Chinese restaurant that is now long gone. We were able to ski Big Sky the way it should be skied, long days, all conditions, going big, with big smiles. 

The following winter Vanessa joined me in Grand Targhee. We skied the best snow of our lives here, but always looking for that next day, next storm, next foot of pow.

Today we have three kids, 9, 8, and 1. We always thought about going back with the kids later on in life. Once I was diagnosed with ALS, Vanessa asked me where my dreams would take us. We are so lucky that Team Gleason got us back skiing at Big Sky and Grand Targhee.

Team Gleason, thank you for making the Rocky Mountain Skiing Adventure a reality for our family. It truly was a life changing experience that came at the perfect time in our lives. The gratitude that our family has to Team Gleason is very hard to express in writing, these memories are written in our hearts and will bring smiles and stories re-told for many years to come. 

We will carry these memories, always. Giving me the opportunity to share an experience with my wife and our children allowed them to join me in one of my biggest joys in my life!"

This blog is must-read!

🌌The most popular place to see the Northern Lights in the United States is Alaska, but what do you do when you don’t want to fly? The Northern Lights are sometimes visible in Northern Minnesota. It’s not common, but it does happen. Mark Elsey always wanted to see the Northern Lights – so Minnesota it is! Team Gleason was more than happy to send him on a winter Adventure.

“Our favorite part of the trip to Minnesota was the beautiful views up north. It snowed part of the time and was just so serene and peaceful. It was a retreat from the normal busy-ness of our lives that we really needed.

The most memorable part was the beautiful views from our hotel windows at the East Bay Motel in Grand Marais, Minnesota, right on Lake Superior. We also enjoyed a day trip together up to Thunder Bay, Canada. And, of course, we laugh at our efforts to see the northern lights, because it was cloudy most of the time we were there, and freezing cold when we went outside at night. We never saw them, but we had fun trying!

This adventure meant more to Mark than words could ever really say. Steve Gleason’s desire to keep living a full life with ALS, and to encourage and support others like Mark to continue doing the same, has brought so much purpose and even joy to our lives, even while we navigate this very challenging disease.” 

❄️ Full story and more photos in our new blog post! Link in bio or check out our stories.

The @nfl schedule releases tonight, and what better time to share our final story from this year’s Super Bowl Adventures!

Team Gleason was honored to help send three individuals living with ALS and their families to Super Bowl LVII with the help of the NFL. Stacy Lewin was able to make it to Phoenix with her husband and two sons to cheer on the Eagles. 

“Stacy and our family are huge Eagles fans and watch all the games. She has always wanted to go to a Super Bowl to watch the Eagles play with our two boys,” wrote Stacy’s husband,  Dan. “She gives so much of herself, always. As her disease progresses like it has since we have hit year two, we have been looking for those family bucket list items.”

So off the family went, flying in from New Jersey to see their beloved Eagle’s play. And while their team lost, they were left with wonderful memories.

-

Thanks to Andrew Jo, the NFL’s Sr. Manager of Retired Player Programs, the families were also able to get down on the field before the game.

Team Gleason is committed to collaborating with leaders in the technology industry in order to develop and advance assistive technology. People living with ALS require access to options, and Apple's latest feature, Personal Voice, provides another choice. This signifies the beginning of a significant transformation that empowers Apple users living with the disease. 

“Voice is a fundamental part of someone's identity,” says Blair Casey, Team Gleason Executive Director and Chair of the The International Alliance of ALS / MND Associations. "Team Gleason’s involvement in the development of this assistive technology feature is a stepping stone. The need for technology like Apple’s Personal Voice feature, will continue to move the industry forward, ensuring that people with ALS and other disabilities have access to the necessary tools to communicate using their own voice. Thanks to Bernice You, an ALS advocate and Phillip Green, a Team Gleason Board Member, for their pivotal contributions in helping our technology team to make significant advancements in expanding access to voice preservation solutions." 

Read 🔗 in profile.

#apple #accessibility #communication #voicepreservation

“The most memorable moments would probably be the sunsets out our window at Camp Margaritaville and going to the top of the Great Smoky Mountains!

There were many challenges, as the world is not really very accessible for me and those like me.
I had to do a lot of watching rather than participating, which has become a hard reality, but we put on the happy face and fight on.

This trip was all I really wanted to do though, spend time with family, see God’s beautiful creations, and breathe.” -Steve K. 

-

Steve was diagnosed with ALS in 2020. Six months after his diagnosis, he and his family were planning on a vacation to spend quality time together. A day before they were set to leave, a fire destroyed their home. While focusing on rebuilding their home, staying active in Jiu Jitsu, and being a dad, the family trip was put on the back burner. 

Team Gleason is proud to have been able to help Steve finally make it to the Smokey Mountains to spend time with his family in nature. 

Read the full blog: https://teamgleason.org/fight-on-smokey-mountains-adventure/

“I see a world where we keep exploring how to serve others, how to care for them, and how to love our human family.” - Steve Gleason

Today, on Global ALS Awareness Day, we take a moment to honor the incredible ALS community that inspires us to learn and grow every day. We have learned a lot over the last eleven and a half years. ALS is not a one size fits all disease. Every individual and family are unique.

We consider ourselves fortunate to have found partners who share our commitment to empowering individuals with ALS to maintain independence at home, navigate the world with functionality, and cherish their loved ones.

Over the past few months, we’ve been working with @irobot and @fairshareinc to innovate toward more thoughtful technology for the home. We’re excited to share the beginning of our journey to get there.

As we envision the future, we see a world that shines brighter than our past. Together, let’s continue exploring ways to serve others, care for one another, and embrace our human family.

💫For our first intern spotlight, we are highlighting our super summer data intern Joshua! 

Joshua is from Metairie, Louisiana where he attended Holy Cross High School. After high school, Josh journeyed uptown to Loyola University of New Orleans where he is a rising Junior studying Finance.

My name is CJ Rodriguez and I have ALS- I was diagnosed September 2022 and estimated my symptoms began in 2020. I am 46 years young. I have 3 beautiful children at all stages.

While searching; my sister recommended looking at Team Gleason. We found Steve and Michel’s story and watched their documentary. We also found their voice banking program and signed up.

The process of approval was so fast and easy.

Shortly after applying for voice banking, my parents decided to do something extraordinary! They wanted me to be able to take my family anywhere we wanted to go. They set up a “Vacation Fund” for me to take my family anywhere we chose to go.

We started looking at going to Disney! We’ve always wanted to go, but never had the opportunity. Now more than ever I wanted to take my kids while I am still able to walk and have most of my mobility.

Ultimately, Disney was very expensive and if we are going to do Disney, we must see everything.

That’s when I looked back at Team Gleason and what else their organization does. That’s when I found Team Gleason’s Adventures! I decided to apply for the Adventure and see what could happen. 

Once again, Team Gleason’s process was so simple and easy! Right after Christmas we got the call that our request for an Adventure to Disney was approved for March! 

That’s right!! We are going to Disney and not just “Disney” no! We are going to all 4 parks at Disney! Team Gleason stepped in and showed all the way out with 4 TICKETS to Disney and 5 nights in Orlando, Florida! 

...𝙩𝙤 𝙗𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙩𝙞𝙣𝙪𝙚𝙙.

#teamgleason #teamgleasonadventure #als #disney #disneyworld #travelingwithALS #nowhiteflags #accessibility

"I contacted Team Gleason for help with acquiring my voice banking. At this point I was prepared for weeks or months of documentation, paperwork, and brick walls. After a couple days, Team Gleason reached out to me and asked for a call to go over my request. The day of the call, I was again ready for another brick wall to enter my life. Instead, I got, caring, compassion and help. It caught me off guard. The answer from Team Gleason on that very phone call was a very simple, we would like to help you. I was floored. They took care of everything and ensured I received my message banking. But then they blew me away with a simple, “What else can we do for you?” I mentioned about our last outing and how my wife had asked me to get a wheel chair so we could go out and spend time together. They said, we would love to help you. They sent me information about the chair they could provide and asked if that would work for my needs. It was more than enough.  Team Gleason put my wheelchair in the mail within days and I had my wheelchair before my insurance company approved my medication.

Since then, my wife and I have started going on long walks together with my chair. It is my most important tool I have in fighting ALS. It allows me to get out and relax, to recharge and to connect with my wife. We can go on long walks together and talk to each other. I can never thank Team Gleason enough, not just for providing my wheelchair, but for providing compassion. The most important thing Team Gleason was able to give me cost nothing. It was my faith in people again.

If you have been diagnosed with a life changing disease. If you are fighting the bureaucracies that stand between you and survival. If you have given up on people. I give you hope. There are people who care, a lot, and they work at Team Gleason. I beg everyone out there, support this great organization. I owe them my faith in people. 

When you run into your next brick wall remember, No White Flags!" 

- Michael J., Rancho Santa Margarita, CA 

#teamgleason #als #nowhiteflags

We are excited to introduce you to the Roon ALS Companion App and Website (Roon.com), a powerful resource designed with you in mind.

The Roon ALS Companion App is an invaluable tool for individuals living with ALS and their caregivers. It boasts a comprehensive collection of over 2,000 short-form videos that address nearly 1,500 questions covering every aspect of ALS. These videos are presented by a diverse panel of over 50 dedicated experts in the field, offering insights, guidance, and support.

Your journey with ALS is unique, and having access to reliable information and support is crucial. We believe that Roon can be a valuable companion on this path, offering you insights, comfort, and a sense of community.

Team Gleason team members are proud to contribute our expertise to better serve the ALS community. We understand the importance of sharing knowledge and supporting one another through this journey.
Roon is available now at roon.com or on the iOS app store.

We are excited to share the cover and release date of Steve’s book, A Life Impossible. 
 
Coming April 30, 2024 
 
A LIFE IMPOSSIBLE 
From NFL player Steve Gleason, a powerful, inspiring memoir of love, heartbreak, resilience, family, and remarkable triumph in the face of ALS.  In 2011, three years after leaving the NFL, Steve Gleason was diagnosed with ALS, a terminal disease that takes away the ability to move, talk, and breathe. Doctors gave him three years to live. He was thirty-three years old. As Steve says, he is now ten years past his expiration date. 
 
LIFE IMPOSSIBLE is a powerful, inspiring memoir of love, heartbreak, resilience, family, and remarkable triumph in the face of ALS. This unsparing portrait argues that a person's true strength does not reside solely in one’s body but also in the ability to face unfathomable adversity and still be able to love and treasure life.

The 2nd Annual Valerie Kiper Golf Tournament was held on Monday October 9th at La Paloma Course at Tascosa Golf Club in Amarillo, TX. This annual golf tournament is held in honor of Dr. Valerie Kiper, who was diagnosed with ALS in December 2020.

Valerie has received the service of Voice and Message Banking through Team Gleason, allowing a synthetic version of her voice to be created using recordings. 

The second year of this event was a major success as Valerie was surrounded by family, friends, and community members for a beautiful day of golf. 

More than 150 golfers made up over 38 teams for the sold-out tournament. In true Texas fashion, a Poker Chip draw was held and raised $5000! Another raffle, Swing for the Bling, included amazing prizes donated by Barnes Jewelry.

The walkway to hole one was lined on both sides with the names of people living with ALS; some in memory and others in honor of.

Overall, the 2nd Annual Valerie Kiper Golf Tournament raised over $69,000! Special thanks to all sponsors for making this event such a success.

After a few delays and tries, Team Gleason was able to help Robert go to John-Boy’s Place in Andalusia, Alabama with his family for his Adventure. ALS Ride for Life generously assisted with the cost of their rental van for the 17 hour trip from Michigan to Alabama.

"Our favorite part of the Team Gleason adventure was being able to spend time traveling with our toddler, and show him the love for traveling that we had before ALS. We were able to relax together, and Robert was able to watch Henry touch the ocean for the first time. It meant so much to us to share these firsts as a family, knowing that Robert was able to see these milestones for Henry was absolutely amazing.

This trip meant more than I can even start to describe. We had dreams of traveling before Robert’s diagnosis, and those dreams were shattered after he endured back surgery, and then an ALS diagnosis at just 23 years old. We weren’t able to show our son that part of our lives beforehand, since we weren’t able to find a way to make Robert comfortable or places that could stay that could accommodate his chair/hoyer lift.

Staying at John-Boys Place was such a breath of fresh air knowing that Leslie had thought of anything and everything that we could have needed while we were there and was able to help with any questions! We were able to share this trip with close friends and family and it was nice to be able to share that space with the people that we love!"

🔗 Read more about Robert's trip here: https://loom.ly/iMJ8gaA

 #teamgleason #als #nowhiteflags #teamgleasonadventure #johnboysplace #alsrideforlife

"This is Roger L., writing from Petoskey, Michigan, with a long-overdue, but much-owed 'thank you' to Team Gleason for the grant that allowed me to get a lift capability on my new @quantum_rehab power wheelchair.  As I had promised a long time ago, included is a photo of me in my absolute favorite, and at least daily (but usually often times daily..) used, chair position.  With ALS progressing as it will, my legs are starting to get more and more swollen, and this position, which I’ve now set in memory as #2, is the best possible treatment [for me]. 

I’ve also been able to do more comforting tasks, like reach into upper cupboards in the kitchen, actually cook a few simple things at the stove (like Ramen!), and the other night some friends came by and I raised myself to 'their level' as we stood around, and they thought it was great, rather than 'looking down on me.' 

Seriously, the grant is much appreciated. Time to 'kick up my heels' again…..

Thank you to Team Gleason!!

-Roger L.,, and wife Julie, of course."

After talking with Betty and her family, we learned that some of her fondest childhood memories are of watching the Phillies baseball games. She grew up in the rural south, and says she remembers finally getting a TV in their home and watching the games.

When applying for her Adventure, Betty wrote that this trip would allow her to spend meaningful time with her two children. “Going to see a Phillies game with my family would be a dream come true,” she wrote. “I have given so much in service to others as an RN; it is so hard for me to ask for help. But, [with the Phillies games] being my only fond memory of my youth, I would love to share this happy pastime with my children and grandchildren.”

We were so happy to assist Betty and her family with a suite at the Philadelphia Phillies vs. Miami Marlins game in July. The Phillies pulled ahead with a one-point win!

This checklist may look simple, and for the average person, easy to complete. Now, imagine you can’t move your arms or legs, you were confined to a wheelchair all day, or you suddenly lost the ability to speak... How would you get this done?

It’s hard to imagine a life where none of this is possible. For those living with ALS, that is the harsh reality they face each day. It’s our mission to provide technology and equipment to make these daily tasks and living with ALS, not just imaginable, but possible.

Team Gleason Foundation provides more equipment and technology to the ALS community than any other organization and the needs are growing.

🗣️ Share your voice with the Speech Accessibility Project!

Now recruiting individuals with ALS to help speech recognition tools understand diverse voices, including those affected by ALS.

The University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign will safeguard your personal information as a part of this project funded by Amazon, Apple, Google, Meta, and Microsoft. Record your speech from the comfort of your home. Mentors from Team Gleason are ready to help you through the participation process. 

Participants can earn up to $180. 
Caregivers can earn up to $90 as well. 

PARTICIPATION CRITERIA:
• Adults age 18 years or older
• Diagnosis of ALS
• Reads or speaks English
• Has a valid email address
• Excludes residents of Texas, Washington, or Illinois (These states have privacy laws that don’t allow us to collect voice prints) 

Sign up here: https://loom.ly/AoxHsLE

For more information, please contact speechaccessibility@beckman.illinois.edu 

#TeamGleason #NoWhiteFlags #ALS #SpeechAccessibilityProject

Team Gleason was happy to help Irene and her family take a jam-packed trip to a wedding in Miami! Read below to see all the fun stuff they did in between, including a pit stop in space!

-

"Oh Em Gee! What a great trip! There is no way to thank Team Gleason enough.

Absolutely no issues with the travel arrangements at all. American Airlines was amazing! Each and every flight crew member was so helpful and respectful. 

The wedding was just beautiful! The family time was great. Sunday, we headed to the beach on Key Biscayne. Nelson, his brother-in-law, nephew and the groom carried me in the wheelchair onto the beach! The bride called me Cleopatra, LOL. 

Monday, we headed to my sisters. It started raining on the ride up and never stopped until we got to the airport to go home. The rain didn’t stop us though. Tuesday, we went to Disney Springs for some shopping and food. Wednesday, we went to Ocala for dinner with my niece and her bestie/teammate. Their game was canceled because of the rain but we had a great time at dinner. Thursday was Kennedy Space Center. Holy moly, that was awesome! It was Nelson’s favorite thing on the trip lol. Friday, we flew home. 

Once again, we can’t thank all of you enough for this wonderful adventure!" -Irene M.
